page.title: 12RECREATION
page.content: To fish at{Carr Mill Dam}a boy's permit is Â£1, but a man's permit is Â£10. You can catch pike,skimmer,roach, bream, gudgeon, carp and tench.You can see speedboats and water-skiing on Sunday and can walk round it in about 2 hours. Children can swim and dig at a sandy shore. It is also good for watching birds. The{Sankey Valley Linear Park}(opened 1981) runs south from Carr Mill Dam to Blackbrook, then ESE to Newton-le- Willows. The Rangers' Centre, where the 6 employees are based is in Blackbrook behind the{Ship Inn}. In 1984, 7500 people booked guided visits to the park and many more made casual visits. The park runs along the length of the now disused Sankey Canal, which was used to take coal from collieries near Blackbrook.
